sentences.en: A slight error in thought may constitute a life - long regret.
A whole consists of parts, the parts constitute the whole.
sentences.cn: 整体由部分组成, 部分构成整体.

sentences.en: Automobile injuries constitute the most common cause for blunt chest injury.
sentences.cn: 汽车撞伤是构成钝性胸部伤的最常见原因.

sentences.en: Both inorganic and organic surfaces constitute the soil adsorption complex.
sentences.cn: 无机和有机表面组成土壤吸附复合体.

sentences.en: But do these facts constitute evidence for the conclusion based on them?
sentences.cn: 但是,这些事实是否构成证据,从而得到以其为根据的结论 呢 ?

sentences.en: Lack of experience does not constitute a major hindrance to progress.
sentences.cn: 经验缺乏并不是进步的主要障碍.

sentences.en: Taken all in all, these four volumes constitute a rich harvest.
sentences.cn: 总的说来, 这四部著作硕果累累.

sentences.en: The company will constitute you captain of the ship.
sentences.cn: 公司将任命你担任这艘船的船长.

sentences.en: These acts constitute an interference in the internal affairs of other countries.
sentences.cn: 这种行动构成对别国内政的干涉.

sentences.en: These constitute the upstream and downstream faces of the porous domain.
sentences.cn: 这些是由多孔区的上游面和下游面组成.

sentences.en: They constitute but a handful of the number.
sentences.cn: 他们只不过是其中的一小撮.

sentences.en: Volunteers constitute more than 95% of The Center's work force.
sentences.cn: 该中心95%以上的工作人员是志愿者.

sentences.en: We must redefine what constitutes a family.
sentences.cn: 我们必须对家庭的构成重新定义。

sentences.en: Women constitute nearly half the able - bodied members of the village.
sentences.cn: 妇女几乎占村里全劳力的一半.

words.tran_cn: 基本的；本质的；制定的；构成分子的
立宪；立宪主义，立宪制度

trans.tran_en: if several people or things constitute something, they are the parts that form it

trans.tran_cn: 组成， 构成， 形成； 设立， 建立； 任命
trans.tran_en: if several people or things constitute something, they are the parts that form it
